item.title: Downloading?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Here’s my old SpoofBrowser

[code=java]package com.io9labs.nineBot.bot;

import java.net.URLConnection;
import java.net.URL;
import java.util.Random;
import java.io.DataInputStream;
import com.io9labs.nineBot.common.*;

/**

  • Basically a fake-browser to make it look like we get the applet off of our browser.

  • @author io9
    */
    public class SpoofBrowser extends Methods {
    String worldPrefix;
    static Random rndm = new Random();
    static StringBuilder strngbldr = new StringBuilder();

    /**

    • Nothing to construct. This is just if we need to statically declare this class
      */
      public SpoofBrowser() { } // Nothing constructed

    /**

    • Loads a page on a website

    • @param url the URL to load

    • @param referer if the page needs a Referer to be sent in its HTTP headers

    • @return a String with the contents of the page
      */
      private String loadPage(String url, String referer) {
      try {
      URLConnection urlc = new URL(url).openConnection();

       urlc.setUseCaches(false);

 urlc.setRequestProperty("User-Agent", "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.2) Gecko/20070219 Firefox/2.0.0.2");
 urlc.setRequestProperty("Connection", "Keep-alive");
 urlc.setRequestProperty("Accept", "text/xml,application/xml,application/xhtml+xml,text/html;q=0.9,text/plain;q=0.8,image/png,*/*;q=0.5");
 urlc.setRequestProperty("Accept-Language", "en-us,en;q=0.5");
 urlc.setRequestProperty("Accept-Encoding", "gzip,deflate");
 urlc.setRequestProperty("Accept-Charset", "ISO-8859-1,utf-8;q=0.7,*;q=0.7");
 urlc.setRequestProperty("Keep-Alive", "300");
 urlc.setRequestProperty("Referer", referer);
 urlc.setRequestProperty("Cookie", "RSORIGIN=runescape; serverlist_order=PWML");
 String contentLength = urlc.getHeaderField("Content-Length");
 log("Downloading " + Float.toString((Float.parseFloat(contentLength)) / 1024) + "KB of data");

 int len = Integer.parseInt(contentLength);
 byte[] data = new byte[len];

 DataInputStream in = new DataInputStream(urlc.getInputStream());
 in.readFully(data);
 in.close();
 
 return new String(data);

      } catch(Exception e) {
      log(“Somehow, an error occured in the SpoofBrowser class whilst downloading a page. A stack trace can be found below”);
      e.printStackTrace();
      log(“Now exiting”);
      System.exit(rndm.nextInt());
      return “FAILED”;
      }
      }

    /**

    • Works just like the loadPage() above, only sends ""http://www.google.com/""
    • @param url the URL to load
    • @return a String with the contents of the requested page.
      */
      public String loadPage(String url) {
      return loadPage(url, “http://www.google.com/”);
      }
      }[/code]

Like replace all the log() shit and make loadpage a return byte[] then write the byte[] to a file.

Read full topic

item.title: Downloading?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

You have to read the file first, then download it using OutputStream or one of its derivitives. You’re not even writing (aka downloading) the file using the write() method.

Read full topic

item.title: Downloading?
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

what would i use to download a song from a url?
i have this but it doesnt work because FileWriter doesnt load from a url along with OutputStreamWriter.

or should i be using BufferedOutputStream instead of BUfferedWriter?

heres what i have so far

i mest with it and changed it a bit
still doesnt work tho =\

it cant download a song from a url but it can make a totaly blank midi

dont tell me i need args i already have it but in a different class

[code]import java.io.;
import java.net.URI;
import javax.swing.;

public class download {

BufferedWriter b = null;
String soundURL = "";
String theSound;

public void findSound() {
	theSound = JOptionPane.showInputDialog("Enter the url to your song.");
	soundURL = theSound;
	downloadSound();
}

public void downloadSound() {
	try {
		URI theURL = new URI(soundURL);
		b = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter (theURL + ".midi"));
		b.flush();
		b.close();
	} catch (Exception e) {
		System.out.println("Error downloading sound");
	}
}


public download() {

}

}[/code]

Read full topic
